resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete this?
to keep this photo, click the save icon.\nto discard this photo, click the delete icon.
What would you like to do?
use these icons as reminders for any special concerns you want to ask about

Before this appointment, write down any questions or concerns you want to talk to the doctor about. After this appointment, write down notes about the appointment, including advice or suggestions that the doctor might have said.
Please answer some questions before this appointment
Please answer some questions about this appointment
You have an unsaved photo. Would you like to\n- save the photo & update the diaper count, or\n- update the diaper count, without saving the photo?
Would you like to update yesterday\'s diaper count?
What activities have you done with your baby today?
Jot down any thoughts about why you think your baby might be feeling this way.
Jot down why your baby might be feeling this way.
<optional> what units would you use to describe this data? (ex: lbs, ozs)
Please wait until next week to report your baby\'s weight.
You must take a photo of the baby on the scale before updating the weight.
Did you enter the weight in correctly:
You have an unsaved photo. Would you like to save the photo & update the weight?
Please allocate at least 10 minutes to take this surveys. Click "next" to start the survey, or click "cancel" to take the survey later.
Thank you for taking this survey!
Please wait to take this survey on

It is very common to feel down after having a baby. Some women find it helpful to talk to someone. Your survey responses suggest that you might be at risk for post-partum depression. You may find it helpful to talk to someone at the Caring for Women with Post-Partum Depression program at St. Joseph\'s Hospital. They can be reached during normal business hours at\n(714) 771-8101.

It is very common to feel down after having a baby. Some women find it helpful to talk to someone. Your survey responses suggest that you might be at risk for post-partum depression. You may find it helpful to talk to someone at the Caring for Women with Post-Partum Depression program at St. Joseph\'s Hospital. They can be reached during normal business hours at (714) 771-8101. You can also find out more about post-partum depression at http://postpartum.net.gravitatehosting.com/Get-the-Facts.aspx.

Remember to take care of yourself. You need to be healthy so that you can take care of your family. Your survey responses suggest that you might be at risk for post-partum depression. Please consider calling St. Joseph\'s or another health professional.
Call a health professional in my address book

Remember to take care of yourself. You need to be healthy so that you can take care of your family. Your survey responses suggest that you might be at risk for post-partum depression. Please consider calling St. Joseph\'s or another health professional.
